titles: The true copye of a prolog wrytten about two C. yeres paste by Iohn Wycklife (as maye iustly be gatherid bi that, that Iohn Bale hath writte[n] of him in his boke entitlid the Summarie of famouse writers of the Ile of great Brita[n]) the originall whereof is founde written in an olde English Bible bitwixt the olde Testament and the Newe. Whych Bible remaynith now in ye Kyng hys maiesties chamber.
author: Purvey, John, 1353?-1428?
Wycliffe, John, d. 1384, attributed name.
Crowley, Robert, 1518?-1588.
publisher: By [Richard Grafton for] Robert Crowley dwellynge in Elie rents in Holburn,
notes: Not in fact by John Wycliffe, but by John Purvey.
The prologue to Wycliffe's translation of the Bible. Another recension was originally published separately in 1540 as: The dore of holy scripture.
Editor's note "To the reader" signed: Robertus Croleus.
At foot of title: Cum priuilegio ad imprimendum solum.
Running title reads: The pathwaye to perfect knowledg.
Quires K and L are in two settings: K1r last line has (1) "Egypt" or (2) "Egipt"; L1r last line has (1) "al" or (2) "all".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
